summary: The Stop Secret Spending Act of 2025 amends the Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act of 2006 to improve reporting of government spending, particularly for 'other transaction agreements' (OTAs). It mandates the inclusion of OTA data on USAspending.gov, requires annual reports on unreported federal spending, and enhances the accuracy and completeness of posted information. It also strengthens Inspector General oversight and calls for a GAO report on related Federal Acquisition Regulation updates.
